H0.text: Who succeeded Nikita Kruschev as leader of the Soviet Union in1964. Leonid Brezhnev

H1.text: Who succeeded Nikita Kruschev as leader of the Soviet Union in1964. Andrei Gromyko

H2.text: Who succeeded Nikita Kruschev as leader of the Soviet Union in1964. Nikolai Podgorny

H3.text: Who succeeded Nikita Kruschev as leader of the Soviet Union in1964. Kosygin

A4.text: Brezhnev became the de jure supreme authority of the Soviet Union upon replacing Khrushchev as the party's First Secretary.

A5.text: In 1964, he took part in the removal of Nikita Khrushchev as leader of the Soviet Union and replaced him as First Secretary of the CPSU.
